value.title: As China tightens its grip on rare earths, can Brazil be an alternative source?
value.content: A worker handles a soil sample at a rare earth exploration project in Caldas Novas, Brazil.

value.title: China’s $143 billion push to dominate the global EV industry
value.content: After years of investing in Europe, Chinese EV and battery firms are turning to Asia, Africa, and Latin America

value.title: Most of the world’s space launches are controlled by just three countries
value.content: A nighttime long exposure of the rock formations at the Rock Garden in Duqm, Oman, captured under a star-filled sky. The six-kilometre site features sandstone and limestone formations shaped by natural forces over millions of years. Photo taken on October 14, 2025, by Tara Atkinson.

value.title: The metaverse is rewriting the rules of who can be a K-pop star
